result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph B Marincic

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Sonderhouse

Defendant Joseph B Marincic in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and the matter is dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Joseph B Marincic in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel just recieved the Discovery and is requesting adjournment and also stated that the defendant is working on getting his license. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph B Marincic in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was found not eligible for the public defender.  Defendant is requesting the court to appoint counsel.  Court have's deft. sworn. Court grants the requests and appoints attorney Ron Sonderhouse at the contract rate. Defendant to reimburse the county and rate to be determined.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph B Marincic in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant doesn't believe he qualifies for a public defender.  Defendant wishes to obtain counsel.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Joseph B Marincic in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
